page.title: 05ECOLOGY:HOLT.WORCS.
page.content: Area of great ecological interest due to wide range of habitats and high density sites.{FLORA} 500-600 wild plants.N.B.Monk Wood: early purple orchis, meadow saffron. Fields in Shrawley Brook Valley: adder's tongue fern, spotted orchis. {FAUNA } Foxes,hares,rabbits,badgers(ancient sett),little owl, tawny owl, 2 rookeries, grass-snakes, slow-worms.In flooded gravel pits:sand martins, little ringed plovers, tufted duck, feral Canada geese, black-tailed skimmer(rare dragon-fly).In rivers and streams:mink, mallard, dipper, moor hen,kingfisher, heron, grey wagtail. In Monk Wood:glow worms, white wood butterfly, terrestrial caddis fly(very rare).In R.Severn and static waters:coarse fisheries. Shrawley Brook:trout stream.
